<TabItem label="TypeScript and TSX" icon="seti:typescript">
## Summary
- Rule available since: `v1.9.0`
- Diagnostic Category: [`lint/style/noRestrictedTypes`](/reference/diagnostics#diagnostic-category)
- This rule has a [**safe**](/linter/#safe-fixes) fix.
- The default severity of this rule is [**warning**](/reference/diagnostics#warning).
- Sources: 
  - Same as [`@typescript-eslint/no-restricted-types`](https://typescript-eslint.io/rules/no-restricted-types)

## Description
Disallow user defined types.

This rule allows you to specify type names that you donâ€™t want to use in your application.

To prevent use of commonly misleading types, you can refer to [noBannedTypes](https://biomejs.dev/linter/rules/no-banned-types/)

## Options

Use the options to specify additional types that you want to restrict in your
source code.

```json
{
    "options": {
        "types": {
           "Foo": {
              "message": "Only bar is allowed",
              "use": "bar"
            },
            "OldAPI": "Use NewAPI instead"
        }
    }
}
```

In the example above, the rule will emit a diagnostics if `Foo` or `OldAPI` are used.

## How to configure
```json title="biome.json"
{
	"linter": {
		"rules": {
			"style": {
				"noRestrictedTypes": "error"
			}
		}
	}
}

```
